thread.title: Marshall falls to Wakefield; Madison wins again, blanks Fairfax
thread.title_full: Marshall falls to Wakefield; Madison wins again, blanks Fairfax

author: A Staff Report
title: Marshall falls to Wakefield; Madison wins again, blanks Fairfax
text:
Previous Next Marshall football 
Josh Hurlburt and the Marshall Statesmen played Wakefield Oct. 23 in a showdown for first place. (Photo by Deb Kolt) Posted: Saturday, October 24, 2015 12:18 am | Updated: 12:37 am, Sat Oct 24, 2015. Marshall falls to Wakefield; Madison wins again, blanks Fairfax A Staff Report Northern Virginia Media Services | 0 comments 
In a showdown for first place in the Capitol Conference, the visiting Marshall Statesmen (4-4, 3-1) lost to the host Wakefield Warriors, 33-19, in high school football action Oct. 23. 
With the win, Marshall took over sole possession of first with two games to play in the regular season. Wakefield will be favored to win those contests, as will Marshall in its final two. So there is a good chance Marshall will win the conference title. 
In the Oct. 23 game, Robert Guenther kicked 36 and 23-yard field goals for Marshall, Jelani had a 38-yard scoring run and Cameron Sharp returned a kick 82 yards for a touchdown 
Marshall's led 16-13 in the third period, then Wakefield took the lead for good at 17-16. 
Murray had 66 yards rushing for Marshall and Josh Hurlburt had 22. Marshall quarterback Markel Harrison was 8 of 15 passing for 87 yards. Guenther, Murray and Ian Sweeney each had two catches. 
* In Oct. 23 Liberty Conference football action, the Madison Warhawks (7-1, 5-0) won their sixth straight game by downing the host Fairfax Rebels, 44-0, to remain in first place. 
For Madison in the win, quarterback Jason Gastrock threw touchdown passes of 30 yards to John DeScisciolo and three yards to Nick Conforti. Madison had two interception returns for TD, 36 yards by Paul Gerdon and 35 by Sean Wilkenson. 
Casey Koshuta had a nine-yard scoring run, Nathan Chaput kicked a 26-yard field goal and multiple extra points. 
Koshuta had 66 yards rushing, Gastrock was 11 of 18 passing for 206 yards, and Conforti, DeScisciolo and Jordan Ebersole all had three catches. 
On defense, Rex Boody had a sack and an interception, Kullen Kritsky intercepted a pass, Matt Ragano had a sack and Jimmy Goldsmith made five tackles. 
* In other Oct. 23 Liberty Conference football action, the host McLean Highlanders (0-8, 0-5) lost to the Washington-Lee Generals, 28-0, and the Langley Saxons (1-7, 1-4) fell to the host South Lakes Seahawks, 48-42, after leading 21-6. 
South Lakes scored the game's final 21 points. 
Langley's Jack Anderson threw scoring passes of 78, 30 and 10 yards to Daniel White and he ran for two touchdowns. J.T. Georgelas also had a scoring run for Langley. 
* In non-conference Oct. 23 football action, the Oakton Cougars (3-5, 1-3) lost on the road against the Broad Run Spartans, 28-21, in double overtime. 
For Oakton, Jarrett Bacon had 97 yards rushing and a touchdown, Patrick Francisio had 61 and Janar Ploompuu had two touchdown runs and 35 yards on the ground. 
The game was tied at 14 after regulation. 
For McLean, David Kagan had 79 yards rushing and one catch for 23 yards, Discuss Print Posted in Fairfax , Langley , Madison , Marshall , Mclean , Oakton , Football on Saturday, October 24, 2015 12:18 am.
